text:
Comparison
shopping performed by an employee of a retail store who merely reports to the
buyer the prices at a competitor’s store does not qualify for the
administrative exemption.  However, the buyer who evaluates such reports on
competitor prices to set the employer’s prices generally meets the duties
requirements for the administrative exemption.   29
CFR § 541.203(i)
html:
Comparison shopping performed by an employee of a retail store who merely reports to the buyer the prices at a competitor’s store does not qualify for the administrative exemption.  However, the buyer who evaluates such reports on competitor prices to set the employer’s prices generally meets the duties requirements for the administrative exemption. 

 

29 CFR § 541.203(i)
